dt: {bc}one intended for funeral or memorial rites

pt: The meaning of English {it}dirge{/it} is not directly related to the meaning of the Latin word it comes from. {it}Dirge{/it} and its earlier form {it}dirige{/it} come from the first word of a Latin chant used in the church service for the dead: {ldquo}Dirige, Domine deus meus, in conspectu tuo viam meam{rdquo} (Direct, O Lord my God, my way in thy sight). The first word of the Latin chant became the English term for a song or hymn of grief.

et: Latin {it}dirige{/it} (the first word of a Late Latin antiphon), imperative of {it}dirigere{/it} {ldquo}to direct{rdquo}
shortdef: a song or hymn of grief; especially : one intended for funeral or memorial rites
